content: hunglish knitter hunglish lace tee sizes s m l xl xxl chest circumference the sizes s m l xl xxl are designed to fit an approximate bust circumference of 90-95 95-100 105- 110 110-115 115-120 cm 35 4-37 4 37 4-39 3 41 3-43 3 43 3-45 2 45 2 -47 2 inches gauge 23 sts x 30 row in stockinet stitch on 4 mm us8 needles = 10 x 10 cm 4 x 4 inches needles circular needles 4 mm us6 and 3 mm us2 5 materials 8 stitch markers for the raglan 2 bobby pins or 2 stitch markers for the bobby pin technique yarn suggested yarn weight 3light shown here in patons beehive baby delicate green 70% acrylic 30% polyester 3 5 oz / 100 g = 389 yd /328 m estimated skeins needed depending on the length 2 3 4 5 6 times of 3 5 oz / 100 g = 389 yd /328 m 3light weight yar pattern the sweater is worked top down with raglan increases on the yoke short row are worked at the back of the neck with bobby pin technique the neckline is finished with a delicate margin giving a unique look for the sweater optional after raglan increases the yoke is divided for body and sleeves and the whole sweater is page 1 of 7 worked in the round with magic loop technique for detailed instructions see video at hunglish knitter youtube channel https //www youtube com/@hunglishknitter raglan instructions increases are worked differently before and after raglan stitches and differently on the right side or on the wrong side they are worked as follows see video at hunglish knitter youtube channel m1r from the rs insert the left needle under the strand that runs between two stitches from back to front then knit this strand from the ws insert the left needle under the strand that runs between two stitches from front to back then purl this strand through the back loop twisted m1l from the rs insert the left needle under the strand that runs between two stitches from front to back then knit this strand through the back loop twisted from the ws insert the left needle under the strand that runs between two stitches from back to front then purl this strand yoke cast on 100 104 108 112 120 sts on a 3 mm us2 5 60 80 and/or 100 cm 24 32 and/or 40 inches circular needle with your preferred method neckband join to work in the round making sure that the cast-on edge is not twisted and divide the work in half using the magic loop technique work in 1x1 rib k1 p1 knit the rib as wide as you wish in size small i knitted a 3 cm rib margin optional round 1 knit round 2 *k1 m1rp * repeat from * to * to end of round see explanation below and the video at hunglish knitter youtube channel round 3 * k1
